WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, May 5th, 1864.

9. Leave of absence, for twenty days, is hereby granted the following officers, paroled Prisoners of War, at the expiration of which they will report in person to the Commanding Officer of Camp Chase, Columbus, Ohio: --
Adjutant W. P. Pierce, 11th Kentucky Cavalry.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

11th Cavy
War Department
Adjutant Generals Office
Washington May 5. 1864.
Townsend E. D.
A. A. G.
Order granting leave of absence for 30 days to Adjt W. P. Pierce 11" Cavy,,
Recd A. G. O May 10. 1864-
